member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.CreationCollisionOption
member.summary: Specifies what to do if an with the specified name already exists in the current folder when you create a new file or folder.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.FailIfExists
member.summary: Throw an exception.
member.remarks: Windows.Storage specifies that the exception will be a , but we can be more specific in the exception type.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.GenerateUniqueName
member.summary: Automatically append a number to the base name of the new file or folder.
member.remarks: For example, if the folder MyFolder (2) already exists, the resulting folder will be MyFolder (3), and if the file MyFile.xaml.cs does, the new one will be named MyFile (2).xaml.cs.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.OpenIfExists
member.summary: Return the existing item.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.ReplaceExisting
member.summary: Replace the existing item.

member.value: The type in standard MIME format; for example, audio/mpeg.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageFile.FileType
member.summary: Gets the type of the file as declared by its extension.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem
member.summary: Manipulates storage items (files and folders) and their contents, and provides information about them.

member.summary: Describes the properties of a storage item.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem.DateCreated
member.summary: Gets the date and time the current item was created.
member.remarks: For the date and time of the last edit, see .
member.value: The date and time the current item was created, or null if this information is not included on the file; for example (in string format), "Fri Sep 16 13:47:08 PDT 2011".

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the storage item, including (if it exists) the file extension.
member.value: The full name of the file or folder.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem.Path
member.summary: The full path of the file on the file system, if it is located in such an accessible place.
member.remarks: Do not rely on this property to access an item because some items may not have file-system paths. For example, if the item is backed by a URI, or was picked using the file picker.
member.value: The full path of the item (including its name), or an empty string if it is not physically identifiable on the file system.

member.summary: Represents a sequential-access output stream that indicates a request for the data stream of a .

member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption
member.summary: Specifies what to do if a file or folder with the desired name already exists in the destination when you copy, move, or rename an item.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption.FailIfExists
member.summary: Throw an exception.
member.remarks: Windows.Storage specifies that the exception will be a , but we can be more specific in the exception type.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption.GenerateUniqueName
member.summary: Automatically append a number to the base name of the new file or folder.
member.remarks: For example, if the folder MyFolder (2) already exists, the resulting folder will be MyFolder (3), and if the file MyFile.xaml.cs does, the new one will be named MyFile (2).xaml.cs.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption.ReplaceExisting
member.summary: Replace the existing item. This will delete any contents if the existing item is a folder.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption.ReplaceOrMerge
member.summary: If both the existing item and the one being moved or copied are folders, merge the children of both (replacing any files that share the same name). Otherwise, this functions identically to .
member.remarks: This is an extension on the Windows.System enum.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption.MergeAlongside
member.summary: If both the existing item and the one being moved or copied are folders, merge the children of both (generating new names for any files that share the same name according to the rules described for ). Otherwise, this functions identically to .
member.remarks: This is an extension on the Windows.System enum.

member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.Resources.Strings.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.Resources.Strings.Exception_FileNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to File "{0}" does not exist or was deleted.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.Resources.Strings.Exception_FileNull
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Missing reference to file.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageDeleteOption
member.summary: Specifies whether a deleted item is moved to the Recycle Bin (or the platform equivalent) or permanently deleted.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageDeleteOption.Default
member.summary: Use the default behaviour.
member.remarks:
TODO: Describe the decisions made to determine behaviour. For reference, on Windows 10:
If the item is in application storage (accessed through ApplicationData), then permanently deleted
Delete according to default behaviour of File Explorer for the particular save location

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageDeleteOption.PermanentDelete
member.summary: Permanently deletes the item. The item is not moved to the Recycle Bin.

member.returns: A task that completes once the type is read.
member.exception: The enclosing directory no longer exists, and can't use the cached type.
doesn't exist on the file system, probably due to deletion, and can't use the cached type.
The file is unable to be read or is a directory, and can't use the cached type.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageFile.ContentType
member.summary: Get the MIME type of the file contents.
member.remarks: If this is accessed shortly after the is created, this may be a long operation as this is being read from the file on disk. It is saved after the first processing, however, so later accesses are only slightly more than a direct field access.
member.value: The type in standard MIME format; for example, audio/mpeg.
member.exception: The enclosing directory no longer exists, and can't use the cached type.
not found, probably due to deletion, and can't use the cached type.
The file is unable to be read or is a directory, and can't use the cached type.

member.exception: The enclosing directory no longer exists.
doesn't exist on the file system, probably due to deletion.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageFile.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name for the file.
member.remarks: This will typically be stripped of the last file extension.
member.value: The user-friendly name.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageFile.DisplayType
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly description of the item's content.
member.remarks: For example, an image file might return "JPG image".
member.value: The user-friendly type of content.
member.exception: The enclosing directory no longer exists, and can't use the cached type.
doesn't exist on the file system, probably due to deletion, and can't use the cached type.
The file is unable to be read or is a directory, and can't use the cached type.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageFile.FileType
member.summary: Gets the extension of the file .
member.remarks:
If the file has multiple extensions, only the last is returned.
Do not rely on this to determine the file type; while it is the primary indication of type on Windows systems, on other platforms it may only provide a hint (for example, standard plaintext files on Linux are typically not given any extension at all, but text.jpg would be just as valid). If code depends on the type of a file, should be used instead.
TODO: Generate default extension based on MIME type, if it's not included?
member.value: The file extension; for example, .jpg, or null if this is not included in the file name.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageFile.IsAvailable
member.summary: Indicates whether the file is located in an accessible location.
member.remarks: TODO: Make this more robust.
member.value: true if the file is local (and all parent folders can be read by this process), if it is cached locally, or if it can be downloaded; otherwise, false.
member.exception: doesn't exist on the file system, probably due to deletion, and can't use the cached type.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageFile.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the storage item, including (if it exists) the file extension.
member.value: The full name of the file or folder.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageFile.Path
member.summary: The full path of the file on the file system, if it is located in such an accessible place.
member.remarks: Do not rely on this property to access an item because some items may not have file-system paths. For example, if the item is backed by a URI, or was picked using the file picker.
member.value: The full path of the item (including its name), or an empty string if it is not physically identifiable on the file system.
member.exception: The file path is longer than allowed by the system.
The file is unable to be read, or is a directory.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageItemTypes
member.summary: Describes whether a storage item is a file or a folder.
member.remarks: This method is useful for processing the results from a method that returns instances that can be files or folders. To work with the returned items, call the method to determine whether each item is a file or a folder, then cast the item to the proper implementation.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageItemTypes.File
member.summary: A file that is represented as a instance.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageItemTypes.Folder
member.summary: A file that is represented as a instance.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageItemTypes.None
member.summary: A storage item that is neither a file nor a folder.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageOpenOptions
member.summary: Specify the relative permissions if a file is accessed by both input and output streams (both read and write).

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageOpenOptions.None
member.summary: The default behaviour: readers will have lower priority than any writers, and will fail if writes occur.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageOpenOptions.AllowOnlyReaders
member.summary: No writers are allowed on the file, and attempting to open a new writer will fail; likewise, opening a reader with this option will fail if a writer is already open.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageOpenOptions.AllowReadersAndWriters
member.summary: A writer with the same priority as a writer, and so is not invalidated by other streams writing to the same file.
member.remarks: The documentation is unclear on the behaviour; this is my best guess at its meaning.
